channel.title: Legalization?
channel.description: Just felt like hearing everyones personal opinion over the legalization of Marijuana. Feel free to lock this if this kind of discussion is off limits. But I'm looking for serious answers, so keep the joking to a minimum por favor :)

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:

[quote="`Lewk_, post:16, topic:324756"]soak marijuana in nicotine. (make it addictive like cigarettes)
package it
sell it
???/
PROFIT[/quote]

Then people will grow there own healthy marijuana.

Read full topic

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:14, topic:324756”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=421109.msg3093405#msg3093405 date=1263081464]
why the fuck is marijuana illegal while cigarettes arent?
[/quote]

Because the government makes 50 billion dollars a year off cigarettes.[/quote]
Do you know how many problems would be solved if it was legalized?

Read full topic

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:9, topic:324756”][quote author=Explisionist link=topic=421109.msg3092812#msg3092812 date=1263033310]
Both houses denied it… Case closed.

Obama tried to pass a bill when he got in the white house, stating that it would legalized but you must be 21 to grow and 18 to smoke… When they denied it, he proposed another bill stating that they could smoke it after the age of 18, but if caught growing it they would spend up to 10 years in prison…That bill is still under review in the 2 houses…
[/quote]It’s getting there. It’s legal to hold a gram or so in both
California and Colorado.

Although, threads like this have been closed, it’s interesting to know that a few users on mscp approve of marijuana use. If you really want to be informed, I suggest you watch The Union.

It’s an incredibly detailed documentary on why marijuana is illegal, and reasons as to why it’s misunderstood, promoting it’s legalization. It’s great, honestly one of my favorite movies-- And not just because it’s about weed.

http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-9077214414651731007&ei=sbdIS_HmMZiQqwKHifTXAQ&q=The+Union&hl=en[/quote]

I just put The Union on my Netflix que. And I figured there was a chance that this thread was breaking some rule but honestly I don’t see why it would need to be closed. As long as it’s handled tastefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Explisionist, post:4, topic:324756”]Both houses denied it… Case closed.

Obama tried to pass a bill when he got in the white house, stating that it would legalized but you must be 21 to grow and 18 to smoke… When they denied it, he proposed another bill stating that they could smoke it after the age of 18, but if caught growing it they would spend up to 10 years in prison…That bill is still under review in the 2 houses…[/quote]It’s getting there. It’s legal to hold a gram or so in both
California and Colorado.

Although, threads like this have been closed, it’s interesting to know that a few users on mscp approve of marijuana use. If you really want to be informed, I suggest you watch The Union.

It’s an incredibly detailed documentary on why marijuana is illegal, and reasons as to why it’s misunderstood, promoting it’s legalization. It’s great, honestly one of my favorite movies-- And not just because it’s about weed.

http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-9077214414651731007&ei=sbdIS_HmMZiQqwKHifTXAQ&q=The+Union&hl=en

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

I never thought of it as such a “conspiracy”. I thought the versatility of hemp was just a known fact? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 09, 2010, 09:27:50 am[/size][hr][quote=“ollie123, post:6, topic:324756”]I don’t smoke the shit, but it doesn’t seem to be causing people much harm, so why not?

Because if the government legalized it, they would probably charge loads of tax on it, so people would then buy it from dealers and therefore it would still be illegal, tax evasion.[/quote]

Honestly if it was legal the dealers would probably start doing other things. People would just buy it a store or somebody they know who grows locally.

Read full topic

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Why it’s illegal:

WORLD MYSTERIES

Unexplained Mysteries around the world

Unexplained mysteries, lost civilizations, ancient ruins, sacred writings, strange artifacts, science mysteries, conspiracies and more...

I think it should be legal. I smoked a large amount of it last night and it had no harmful effects against me, and it never will. It can also be used in a great number of things.

The truth that marijuana is not harmful:

Drug Policy Alliance

10 Facts About Marijuana

See Our Marijuana Facts Booklet (PDF)

Read full topic

item.title: Legalization?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I don’t smoke the shit, but it doesn’t seem to be causing people much harm, so why not?

Because if the government legalized it, they would probably charge loads of tax on it, so people would then buy it from dealers and therefore it would still be illegal, tax evasion.

Read full topic
